Package project3

Class CSV

Object
CSV
public class CSV extends Object
Implementation of a simple CSV (comma separated values) files parser.

CSV files consist of rows with multiple entries. The number of entries in each row does not need to be the same. Each entry is separated with a comma character. Simple entries are not delimited, for example
hello, 5, 3.1415, http://nyu.edu
is a row with four entries. Entries that contain reserved characters are assumed to be surrounded by double quotes. Reserved characters are commas and newlines, for example
"hello\nworld!", 5, "5,000,000 miles away", http://nyu.edu
is a row with four entries, two of which have reserved characters.
Note: smart quotes or Unicode quotes are treated like regular characters not entries delimiters.

Sample use of this class: 


 
 		//print each row from the file FILE_NAME.CSV
 		File f = new File("FILE_NAME.CSV"); 
		CSV csv = new CSV( new Scanner(f) ); 
		for (int i = 0; i < csv.getNumOfRows(); i++ ) {
			System.out.println( csv.getNextRow() + "\n"); 
		}
 

 
 		//print fifth entry from each row from the file FILE_NAME.CSV 
 		//(assumes that each row has at least five entries)
 		File f = new File("FILE_NAME.CSV"); 
		CSV csv = new CSV( new Scanner(f) ); 
		for (int i = 0; i < csv.getNumOfRows(); i++ ) {
			System.out.println( csv.getNextRow().get(4) + "\n"); 
		}

  • Constructor Details

    • CSV

      public CSV(Scanner in)
      Constructs a CSV object using the input from the provided Scanner object. Closes the provided Scanner object on successful termination.
      Parameters:
      in - stream from which the data should be read
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - when in is null
      IllegalArgumentException - when no data could be read from in

  • Method Details

    • getNumOfRows

      public int getNumOfRows()
      Returns the number of rows successfully read from the CSV file.
      Returns:
      number of rows in this object

    • getNextRow

      public ArrayList<String> getNextRow()
      Returns a list of entries from the next row. This function provides cyclical access to the rows in this object. The initital call to this function returns the first (index 0) row, the next call returns second row, the next call returns third row, etc, until all the rows are returned. After the last row is requested the following call to this function will return first row again.
      Returns:
      the next row from this object

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this object. The string representation consists of a list of each row entries enclosed in square brackets ("[]"). Adjacent entries are separated by the characters ", " (comma and space). The rows are separated by a newline character \n.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this object
